Description.enUS: Produces Harvesters to allow the gathering of resources. Processes and stores Tiberium
Harvester

Nod basic infantry.
Poorly trained but numerous

Can attack ground units.
The Brotherhood's menacing-looking MCVs can unpack into a Construction Yard. Well-armoured , but slow and unarmed.
The Emissary can locate viable base sites and deploy in order to expand the area in which buildings can be constructed. It is most useful when place near Tiberium fields
Provides power and supply.
Provides power and supply.

Cranes reinforce the production capability of the Nod Construction Yard by adding one extra building production queue. Cranes can not build defensive structures, superweapons, or the Redeemer Engineering Facility.
Produces Nod infantry

A crusader of the Brotherhood, with little humanity left in their heavily modified bodies, these white-plated cyborgs fire penetrating particle beams at armoured targets.

Can attack ground units.

Elite Infantry. Good against light units. Explosives can be placed on buildings.

Can attack ground units.

Nod basic anti-aircraft infantry. Also effective against heavily armored units.

Can attack ground and air units

Able to capture enemy structures, can take over downed large mechs including the Juggernaut, the Avatar, the Annihilator Tripod. Can Repair friendly structures and plant Booby Trap on neutral structures.
Plants a booby trap on to a structure, walker husk The trap detonates as soon as an enemy is close.

Nod advanced infantry, good at fighting buildings and light armored units.

Can attack ground units.

Equipped with volatile explosive devices that detonate when in close proximity to enemy forces. Fanatics are impossible to suppress.

Can attack ground units

Tiberium Troopers are armed with liquid Tiberium throwers that that can clear out garrisoned structures, intoxicate entire infantry platoons, and slow down non-walker vehicles by 50%.

Can attack ground units

Can use their collapsible glider packs to lift off. Can plant explosives on structures. Stealthed both on ground and in air, and are only uncovered when firing

Can attack ground units
Deploys a beacon at the selected location, allowing Specters to fire in the surrounding area.

The Confessor increases friendly units armour and rate of fire
Can use Hallucinogenic Grenades.

Can attack ground units.

The Attack Bike is a quick and light scout vehicle, armed with anti-air rockets and equipped with a scanner array which can detect stealthed units.

Can attack ground and air units.
Detector

High mobility, good at fighting light armored units. Can use EMP ability

Can attack ground units.

Equipped with a laser capacitor with high damage.

Can attack ground units.

Assault unit, good at attacking infantry and buildings.

Can attack ground units.

Causes area-of-effect damage to the air.

Can attack air units.

Invisible. Uncloaked when attacking.

Can attack ground and air units.

A siege unit that can charge the Stone of Light. Can be upgraded to be used with Venom to attack air and ground targets on longer distance.

Can attack ground units.

Mobile artillery, invisible. Unlocked when attacking

Can attack ground units.
Restore mobile mode.
Unpack the vehicle, allowing the crew to fire outwards.

This massive walker is equipped with a portable version of the Obelisk laser. Avatars may further enhance their immense power by literally ripping pieces from other Nod vehicles. When badly damaged, Avatars leave a husk that can be captured by Saboteurs (or their equivalents) of any side,

Can attack ground units.
Aircraft Production Facility. Each Air Tower provides docking bays for up to four Vertigo Bombers, where they are rearmed.

Highly mobile air unit with bonus vs light.

Can be used against air and ground

Air transport unit.

No weapons
The Operations Center contains advanced communications arrays required for Nod's higher-tier technologies and can deploy counter-intelligence support powers

Nod's Secret Shrine contains special training rituals necessary to deploy advanced infantry. It can also be used to research advancements that substantially improve the effectiveness of most Nod infantry squads.
When a Tech Lab is present, the Brotherhood of Nod can deploy its most advanced military equipment, as well as research upgrades to its lower-tech vehicles.
Built on a gas spring and used to collect high-energy gas.
Air Support Towers have four landing pads for aircraft. They can repair and rearm, but cannot construct aircraft.

The Redeemer Engineering Facility can build all Nod vehicles like a standard War Factory, and is the only structure capable of deploying Nod's epic unit -- the Redeemer.
Only one Nod Redeemer Engineering Facility can be built at a time per player. Cannot be captured.

Giant walker. It can garrison up to 2 infantry squads to increase firepower and specialization. Can use Rage Generator

Can attack ground units.

Provides upgrade options for battlecruisers.

Enable:
- Battlecruisers can be built in starports
This statue of the great prophet himself affects nearby friendly infantry by increasing their firing rate by 50% and armour by 25%. Note: Only one Nod Voice of Kane can be built at a time per player.

Nod's defensive turrets are organized in such a way that their central hub manages the operation of three turrets that are directly connected to it through visible cables. If individual turrets are destroyed, they will be automatically replaced for free after a delay. If the hub itself is destroyed, all turrets connected to it are destroyed with it. When placing Shredder, Laser and SAM Turrets, the hub has to be placed first, and then the three individual turrets, which must be placed close to the hub.

Base Defense. Strong vs Infantry
Place hun and then three surrounding turrets. If hub is lost all turrets are destroyed.

Can attack ground units.
